definition: first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
beginning/first day of lunar month/north
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
non-Han tribes in the east and north of ancient China/barbarians
the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
to present tribute (to the emperor)
Song dynasty (960-1279)/used to distinguish it from 劉宋|刘宋 Song of Southern dynasties (420-479)
to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to found a country
bogus dynasty/pretender
feudatory/vassal state
regime/political power
worship/to revere/to venerate
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
Southern Dynasties (420-589)
suzerain state/mother country (of a colony)
